Legal_Issue: Whether the applicants qualify as refugees or persons in need of protection under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Type: Claimed fear of persecution due to intervention in domestic dispute
Legal_Provision: Sections 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to membership in a social group, risk of torture
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to prove internal flight alternative was unsafe
Application_Error: Failure to establish well-founded fear of persecution or risk of torture
Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on applicant to demonstrate eligibility under IRPA
Application_Factor: Intervention in a domestic dispute in Mexico
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of the Refugee Protection Division’s decision
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Sections 96 and 97, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Outcome_of_Review: Dismissed – no question of law certified
Cause_of_Refusal: Applicants failed to prove persecution or that internal relocation was not a viable option
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to support claims under sections 96 and 97
Credibility_Issues: Lack of sufficient evidence undermined credibility
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of decision
Omission_Type: Failure to provide evidence on internal flight alternative
